skill.name: checkpoint
skill.description: Save current progress to memory-keeper to prevent work loss.
skill.summary: Save current progress to memory-keeper to prevent work loss.
skill.author: Barnhardt-Enterprises-Inc

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill containing only markdown documentation. It describes how to use existing memory-keeper MCP tools. No executable code, scripts, or files that could pose security risks.

content.user_title: Save progress to prevent context loss
content.value_statement: Context exhaustion can cause complete work loss. This skill provides checkpoint commands to save progress to memory-keeper, enabling recovery and preventing catastrophic data loss during long sessions.
actual_capabilities: Save current task state with context_save MCP tool
Create named checkpoints with context_checkpoint MCP tool
Prepare context for compaction before exhaustion
Recover previous state after context loss via /recover
Save todo list state for recovery
limitations: Requires memory-keeper MCP server to be configured
Cannot restore state without prior checkpoints
Does not prevent context exhaustion, only enables recovery
Checkpoint frequency depends on user discipline

use_cases.title: Prevent work loss
use_cases.description: Save progress every 5-10 tool calls during implementation to enable recovery if context is exhausted

use_cases.title: Switch tasks safely
use_cases.description: Checkpoint before switching contexts to preserve implementation state and next action

use_cases.title: Track hypotheses tested
use_cases.description: Save checkpoint after each debugging hypothesis to avoid repeating tested paths

prompt_templates.title: Quick checkpoint
prompt_templates.prompt: Checkpoint my current progress. Save the current task, files modified, and next action to memory-keeper.

prompt_templates.title: Session end save
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a final checkpoint before ending this session. Include full progress summary and exact next step.

prompt_templates.title: Recovery request
prompt_templates.prompt: Recover my previous checkpoint state so I can continue from where I left off.

prompt_templates.title: Large operation prep
prompt_templates.prompt: Prepare context for compaction and checkpoint current state before this large operation.

output: - Next action: Fix auth token refresh bug

best_practices: Checkpoint after every file creation or modification
Always save next-action with high priority for continuity
Create named checkpoints before large operations like builds or refactoring
anti_patterns: Waiting until context is nearly exhausted to checkpoint
Skipping checkpoint after completing significant work
Not saving next-action, forcing reorientation on recovery

faq.question: How often should I checkpoint?
faq.answer: Every 5-10 tool calls during active work. After file changes, test runs, or task completion.

faq.question: Does checkpointing slow down work?
faq.answer: Minimal overhead. Takes seconds but prevents hours of lost work from context exhaustion.

faq.question: Can I recover from any checkpoint?
faq.answer: Yes, use /recover command to restore from the most recent named checkpoint.

faq.question: Is my checkpoint data stored securely?
faq.answer: Checkpoints are stored in memory-keeper MCP database on your local system.

faq.question: What happens if I never checkpoint?
faq.answer: No recovery is possible if context is exhausted. All progress in that session will be lost.

faq.question: How is this different from Claude Code's native context?
faq.answer: Memory-keeper checkpoints survive beyond single Claude sessions, enabling multi-day project continuity.
